instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image (dropped laptop)
threads.message:
Okay, I’m properly stuck on this one. In fact it’s the second board which I've failed to fix with the same symptoms.
Both of these boards are the result of being dropped.

The issue is I cannot get an image out, either externally or the LCD.  (<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.3V)

The board powers up, chimes, can be PRAM reset.
I get <SIGNAL>ALL_EG_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, so the power side of the GPU is ok.
I’m basically missing <SIGNAL>LVDS_IG_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>. Which is generated by <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>.
I know its not the PCH, I swapped this out on the 1st board. I also replaced the GPU.
(I usually dont start swapping stuff out)

You can see I’m out of ideas, its probably hopeless, as I’m beginning to think this issue is inside the board.
I thought I’d try here to see if anyone has solved this.?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image (dropped laptop)
threads.message: I would more suspect GPU is not initialized. If this was after a drop I think you already know it is most likely a ripped trace under the CPU/GPU. Check diode mode on all the caps in the PCIE lanes from CPU to GPU. Could also be balls/traces under the MUX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image (dropped laptop)
threads.message:
I replaced GPU, MUX and PCH, only leaves CPU and traces inside board. I checked PCIe lines with a known good board and they are all fine. 

I might as well re-ball the CPU, what have i got to loose, already about 4-5 hours deep into this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no image (dropped laptop)
threads.message: I honestly wouldn't bother with a board that had a known impact damage.
